intro: Prestonia versicolor, commonly known as the variable prestonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Prestonia versicolor is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
